name: Intervention Dispatch
effect: When you activate a system with the Deployable tag you gain 5 Overshield.
description: Constructing to protect. Some Lancers understand that there’s more value in building new things then destroying the old.

name: Optimised Small Arms Assortment
effect: Your auxiliary weapons deal +2 bonus damage.
description: Widespread across the stars, there’s nothing quite like finetuned weapons for the job.

name: Emergency Foam
effect: While not quite as universal as the widespread Everest parts, all of GMS and her subcontractors construct with longevity and replaceability in mind.
description: Detonating frames are reportedly the cause for over half the collateral damage in contemporary urban warfare causing untold suffering completely preventable through better safety practice.

name: Partial Compatibility
effect: 1/mission your frame can repair 1 structure damage for 1 Repair, instead of 2 Repairs.
description: While not quite as universal as the widespread Everest parts, all of GMS and her subcontractors construct with longevity and replaceability in mind.

name: Reactor Safety Redundancy
effect: When you take stress damage, roll 1d6. On a 6, an emergency valve vents off the heat that would have caused you to take stress damage instead. This system can only successfully trigger once per full repair.
description: The second most frequent cause of a Lancer’s death is his own reactor.

name: Readiness Reset
effect: When you activate your core system you clear off all heat.
description: Parts compatibility is an opportunity for new synergies in the interplay of systems.

name: Black Market Teleporter
effect: Whenever you take structure damage you can teleport to a free space adjacent to one of your allies.
description: This definitely isn’t commercially available tech but who cares about such stuff when it works.

name: Blink Patch
effect: Whenever you teleport, you gain 3 Overshield afterwards.
description: The future of travel, instantaneous and only with a 5% chance of causing lasting damage to human health.

name: Space Fitting
effect: Your frame becomes fully equipped with all necessary systems to operate in space without any issues. You can move unimpaired in zero-g environments.
description: Any self-serious Lancer keeps his machine ready to fight with his soul no longer weighed down by gravity.

name: Mobile Infantry Coordination
effect: When you hit with an attack, the next attack performed by a biological ally against the same target gains +1 accuracy, and its damage can’t be reduced in any way.
description: Combined arms tactics shape the battlefield since before Union. While mostly rendered obsolete thanks to the advent of the mobile chassis, the infantry man still plays a vital part in some operations.

name: Leucocyte code
effect: Whenever an enemy hits you with a tech attack, you gain Bolster afterwards.

name: Innovation Calculator
effect: 1/round, as a reaction at the start of any allied character’s turn, you may make a Bolster tech action on any character within line of sight and Sensors.
description: Linking Networks even in the age of the omninet is an opportunity to put our minds together.

name: High Frequency Cycling
effect: 1/scene you can clear one condition as a free action.
description: Computers need to be as capable of their operators. Without the adequate gear a skilled fighter won’t be able to perform his best.

name: High Performance Standards
effect: Whenever you enter the danger zone, you gain Bolster until the start of your next turn.
description: Beyond safety limiters, the best of the best work their magic.

name: High Velocity Combatant
effect: While in flight, you gain immunity to Slowed and Immobilised.
description: You and your machine are one unit, a weapon, an unstoppable force.

name: Full Broadside
effect: After finishing a barrage, you gain +1 accuracy on your next attack.
description: Only amateurs trust ballistics tables, professionals trust their experience.

name: Crowsnest Backup
effect: If your line of sight would be restricted to adjacent spaces, you can still draw line of sight 3 spaces wide instead.
description: There’s still a place for outdated equipment. It’s rugged and reliable with centuries of experience.

name: Armoured Mutiny
effect: When you deal an enemy structure damage, they become exposed until the end of your next turn.
description: If you could make God bleed, people will cease to believe in Him. There will be blood in the water, and the sharks will come.
